intro: Pleurospermum anomalum, commonly known as the strange pleurospermum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
